meanings.definition: To work again or differently on (something) in order to improve or alter it.
meanings.sent1: She reworked her painting to make it brighter.
meanings.sent2: He reworked the essay to fix the errors.
meanings.sent3: The chef reworked the recipe to add more flavor.
meanings.sent4: The designer reworked the dress to fit better.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic reworked the engine to run smoother.

meanings.definition: To make changes to (something) in order to improve it.
meanings.sent1: They reworked the website layout for better navigation.
meanings.sent2: The team reworked the project plan for efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The students reworked their presentation to include more details.
meanings.sent4: The gardener reworked the garden design for a fresh look.
meanings.sent5: The tailor reworked the dress to enhance its beauty.

meanings.definition: To revise or edit (written or printed material).
meanings.sent1: The editor reworked the article for clarity.
meanings.sent2: She reworked the manuscript to meet the word count.
meanings.sent3: The writer reworked the story to add a twist.
meanings.sent4: He reworked the document to correct the grammar.
meanings.sent5: The student reworked the essay to improve the flow.
